thread.title: Trump Fires Acting Attorney General Who Wouldn't Defend Travel Ban
thread.title_full: Trump Fires Acting Attorney General Who Wouldn't Defend Travel Ban

author: Tierney Sneed
title: Trump Fires Acting Attorney General Who Wouldn't Defend Travel Ban
text:
The White House announced Monday that it had fired Acting Attorney General Sally Yates, who had order the Department of Justice not to defend the controversial immigration executive order President Trump signed Friday. Yates had "betrayed the Department of Justice," by refusing to defend the order, a White House press release said.
Dana Boente, the U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, has replaced Yates as Acting Attorney General, the White House said. Boente was appointed to the U.S. Attorney position by former President Obama in 2015.
According to a White House pool report, senior assistant press secretary Michael Short told the pool reporter that Boente had been sworn in around 9 p.m. and that he had the authority to sign foreign surveillance warrants.
